title: Student Random Sample
question_text:
Suppose the student council at a large high school wants to measure student approval of school leadership using a simple random sample of size n=100.
What would be the best way to select these students?

choices.text:
Go to the cafeteria during lunch and select
5
students at each table until the sample size is
100
.

Since
100
students are currently enrolled in AP Statistics in this school, sample those
100
students.

Obtain a list of all students from the registrar and assign a number to each, then use a random number generator to select
100
students.

Since government is a required daily course, survey all the students in the government classes during one school day until
n
=
100
.

Have each of the
10
members of the student council ask
10
of their friends, telling the members try to ask different types of people.
